column2: ALASKA DMV WRITTEN TEST
Question Text
1. What do pennant-shaped signs indicate?
2. To reduce their chances of colliding with an animal, drivers should:
column4: Slow down when approaching animals that are standing near the road.
column6: scan the sides of the road to watch for the reflection of vehicle headlights in the eyes of animals.
column8: look well down the road and far off to each side.

column2: 3. What happens if two vehicles reach at the same time an intersection with four-way stop signs?
column6: The driver on the right yields to the driver on the left.
column8: The first vehicle to reach the intersection must yield.
column10: The driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.

column2: 4. This regulatory sign tells drivers that:
column4: all vehicles must turn left immediately.
column6: traffic in the right lane must go straight.
column8: traffic in the left lane must turn left at the intersection ahead.

column2: 5. Which shape is a speed limit sign?
6. When exiting a highway, you should slow down:
column4: when you first see the exit sign.
column6: before moving into the exit lane.
column8: once you have moved into the exit lane.
column10: once you see the toll booth.

column2: 7. When there is a _______ at an intersection, you should come to a complete stop, yield to cross traffic/pedestrians, and then proceed when clear.
8. When the road surface is wet or slippery, drivers should increase their following distance to:
9. What does the flashing signal in the picture indicate?
column6: Pedestrians should finish crossing the street if started.
column8: Pedestrians should start crossing the street.
column10: The same thing as a stop sign.

column2: 10. This road sign means:
11. You may park or stop along the shoulder of the freeway:
column4: if you need to check your smartphone for directions.
column6: only if you have an emergency.
column8: if no part of your vehicle is on the road.
column10: as long as you turn on your emergency flashers.

column2: 12. What does a flashing left yellow arrow mean?
column4: Vehicles turning left must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.
column8: Left turns are allowed. Yield to oncoming traffic and pedestrians.

column2: 13. This regulatory road sign indicates that:
column4: Slower vehicles traveling on multiple lane highways must stay in the right hand lane.
column6: Vehicles must slow down and stay in the right lane.
column10: The right hand lane is reserved for buses and car-pool vehicles.

column2: 14. More than one vehicle is approaching a four-way stop sign. Who has the right of way?
column4: The first driver to reach the intersection and stop.
column10: The last driver to reach the intersection.

column2: 15. Diamond-shaped signs:
column4: are used to warn of hazards on roadways.

column2: 16. This sign indicates the _______________ vehicles can safely travel in this area.
17. Destination signs are ______ with ____ letters and symbols.
18. Speed limit signs are:
19. A flashing red light means:
column6: The same as a STOP sign.
column8: Go, but yield the right-of-way to other traffic at the intersection.
column10: The light will soon change to steady red.

column2: 20. Which of the following is a defensive driving skill/technique?
column4: Keep your vehicle in good condition.
column6: Do not drive if you are very weary.
